item.title: Hollow Knight Silksong Player Beats Every Boss Without Getting Hit
item.description:
A dedicated fan of Hollow Knight Silksong has completed an impressive task within the massively popular game, defeating every boss in the game without taking a single hit. The beloved Metroidvania game from Team Cherry has taken the gaming world by storm with its recent release, finally seeing its launch after spending years in development. Early fan reception to the game has been stellar, with Hollow Knight Silksong sitting as one of the highest-reviewed games of 2025. One fan of the game has now accomplished an impressive feat with the game's litany of bosses.

Hollow Knight Silksong boasts a wide array of bosses for players to challenge throughout the game's grimdark world. Silksong boasts a total of thirty-six different bosses, with enemies like Trobbio and Groal the Great already becoming some of the game's most popular enemies. The game has also been lauded for its jump in difficulty from the original Hollow Knight , with many of the bosses in Silksong posing a more difficult challenge for players to overcome. Now, a Hollow Knight fan has not only managed to defeat every boss, but take them down in a perfect fashion.

As reported by PCGamer, a Silksong player has completed every single boss in the game without taking a single point of damage in the process. Content creator CrazyTemplar shared the impressive feat on their YouTube channel, showcasing a nearly two-hour-long video of the player fighting every Silksong boss. The YouTuber even cleared several hidden bosses, like those exclusive to the game's permadeath mode, in their quest to defeat every boss in Hollow Knight Silksong . The user chronicled their quest to conquer every boss without taking damage on their channel, with several videos defeating different groups of bosses.

Hollow Knight: Silksong Player Beats Every Boss Without Taking Damage

The impressive Silksong achievement comes as fans have continued to discover new things about the game since its launch. One fan recently pointed out that a pair of achievements exclusive to the permadeath mode are not included on the PlayStation Network, making Silksong 's Platinum Trophy easier to earn on PS5. Silksong also already boasts a robust modding scene, with players introducing everything from skin mods for Hornet to a full co-op mod for Silksong allowing players to team up with friends.

Hollow Knight Silksong 's release earlier this month served as one of the most monumental gaming events of the year, to the extent it has affected other games surrounding it. Several games set to release in the same time-frame as Silksong have seen delays in recent weeks, looking to not align their launches with the mega-popular game. Silksong 's release date even caused player counts for the original Hollow Knight to spike, with fans eager to finally play the sequel. Hollow Knight Silksong 's early success will likely lead to plenty more fans finding their own creative ways to complete the already-beloved game.

item.title: All Grow a Garden Fall Market Pets
item.description:
With fall around the corner, Grow a Garden has introduced fall-type pets in its latest 1.23.0 update. First up is the new Fall Egg, which you can buy for 90M Sheckles from the event market. It takes about four hours and 10 minutes to hatch, but with egg-hatching pets like Blood Kiwis or Ostrich, you can crack it open much sooner.

This egg can give you six fall-themed pets, including Robin, Badger, Grizzly Bear, Barn Owl, and Swan. But the feast doesn’t stop there; you can also pick up around five more critters from the Fall Pet Shop, each with unique traits. This guide covers all the pets you can get from the Fall Market in Grow a Garden , along with their odds, costs, and passives.

All Fall Egg Pets and Probabilities

Fall Egg

Odds

Description

Robin

55%

Cuts player size down by 15% to 20%, so your avatar ends up smaller.

Badger

32.5%

Every ~5:06 minutes, it moves the ground for 20.45 seconds by burrowing. Fruits within 20.45 studs have about a 10.18% chance per second to get the Cracked Mutation (4x multiplier).

Grizzly Bear

10%

It forces the Fall Mutation (4x multiplier) on fruits closest to the pet (the ability triggers every 3:44 minutes). Plus, it also makes your character 8.22% bigger in this Roblox experience.

Barn Owl

1.5%

Pets bought straight from shops get a 0.1 to 0.22 kg weight boost (but not more than 3 kg). If you’re using Fall-type pets in your garden, they will earn an extra 0.76 XP per second.

Swan

1%

It goes to another player’s pet roughly every 24:39 minutes to befriend it and use its ability, and every 4:57 minutes, it blesses a fruit with the Graceful Mutation.

All Fall Pet Shop Critters and Their Traits in Grow a Garden

All Fall Pet Shop Pets

Cost

Trait

Chipmunk

150M Sheckles

With this pet, there’s a 6.24% chance your Harvest Tool won’t use up a charge!

Red Squirrel

400M Sheckles

When Fall-type pets wrap up their traits, their cooldown is reduced by 14.43 seconds! (Meaning you can enjoy their abilities faster.)

Marmot

700M Sheckles

The Marmot digs a hole and hides in it every 8.54m. If you find it, it grants a Fall-themed reward like cosmetics, seeds, and more. It also has a 15.08% chance to use the ability again.

Sugar Glider

900M Sheckles

Every 19:54 minutes, it moves over three fruits, takes one mutation from each, and triggers it to the next fruit. This gives all three fruits an extra mutation on top of the ones they already have.

Space Squirrel

1,200M Sheckles

Every 17:54 minutes, there’s roughly a 15% chance it triggers Voidtouched Mutation (135x multiplier).

If you’re wondering how useful the Fall Update pets are in Grow a Garden , which ones aren’t worth the grind, and where they rank , our Best Pets Tier List can help.

item.title: Silksong: How to Get Barbed Bracelet
item.description:
When it comes to Hollow Knight: Silksong , players will find out that there is a lot of Tool variety, catering to every situation, be it going through platforming or facing waves of enemies. When it comes to increasing the overall damage of Hornet's needle, players have to resort to finding Pale Oils and bringing them back to Bellhart. However, there is a Tool in the game that also does that, but there is a catch with it.

The guide below offers information on what players have to do to acquire the Barbed Bracelet and whether it is worth equipping it over other tools in Hollow Knight: Silksong .

How to Get the Barbed Bracelet in Silksong

To get the Barbed Bracelet , you will first need to reach Shellwood and acquire the Wall jump ability. This requires defeating Sister Splinter and going right from the boss arena to find the ability. With the ability, make your way to Greymoor Bellway Station , head left, and enter the first tower. Keep going up until you can find a passage on the right that leads to the second tower. Head further right and go through the passage on the right.

You can make the elevator go down, giving you a shortcut to the Halfway Home bench.

From the elevator, you can pogo the metal spikes on the left, then float to the right, where you can down slash a ball and reach the top right, where there is a passage leading right. This puts you in Sinner's Road , where you can ignore the imprisoned green mantis above you and head far right. Go through the room with the multiple Muckroaches , and at the end, do not take the path going up; instead, head inside the cage and drop. Avoid the spikes, and you will find the Barbed Bracelet on top of a wooden raft.

Do not step into the water in this area, as it contains Muckmaggots that can poison you. An easy way to remove the maggots is to use your Bind; this will not heal you, but the maggots will go away.

How Does It Work & Is It Worth It in Silksong?

The Barbed Bracelet is a Yellow tool that increases your total damage output, but also increases the damage you take. This makes it very situational because the increase in damage taken makes it so that most bosses will two-shot you , as you have less than eight mask shards before reaching the end of the game. There are also a lot of platforming sections in the game where most enemies, along with the traps and spikes on the wall, do two mask damage; with the Barbed Bracelet equipped, you will not last more than a minute before going back to the bench. The tool is not that bad against certain bosses that are predictable , and where you are confident in your skills to not get hit.

If you are trying to farm for Rosaries, this is a must-have Tool. Most of the time during a farm, you might take one or two hits, but paired up with the Fractured Mask , you will be able to withstand three hits and also take out the enemies much faster. The Barbed Bracelet also increases the damage of the Clawline ability once you unlock it. Harpooning enemies and dashing away makes most farms relatively easy and shorter.

item.title: Hollow Knight: Silksong Is Surprisingly Easier to Platinum on PlayStation
item.description:
Hollow Knight: Silksong is missing numerous trophies on PlayStation compared to its achievements on other platforms. The omissions, which may have been out of the developer's hands, make the PS4 and PS5 versions of Hollow Knight: Silksong significantly easier to platinum.

Gameplay spoilers—detailing the premise of Silksong's most difficult achievements—ahead.

Some players have been complaining about Hollow Knight: Silksong being too difficult ever since the game was released on September 4, arguing that its very start is an exceedingly punishing experience. For those who disagree, the game offers a few bonus challenges that significantly up the stakes, with several of them revolving around Steel Soul, a permadeath mode that deletes one's save file when they die.

Hollow Knight: Silksong's Hardest Achievements Aren't Available on PlayStation

As noted by TheGamer, two achievements associated with Hollow Knight Silksong 's semi-secret permadeath mode aren't available on PlayStation consoles. These are Steel Soul and Steel Heart, which require players to beat the mode and do it with a 100% completion, respectively. As a result, PS4 and PS5 owners have a significantly easier time platinuming Silksong compared to their peers on other platforms.

Most Difficult Hollow Knight: Silksong Achievements Missing on PSN

  • Speed Completion : Achieve 100% game completion and finish the game in under 30 hours
    • PSN still has the 5-hour speedrun trophy

  • Steel Soul : Finish the game in Steel Soul mode
  • Steel Heart : Achieve 100% game completion and finish the game in Steel Soul mode

Steam and Xbox each list 52 achievements for Hollow Knight: Silksong . Conversely, there are only 34 of them on PlayStation. With the exception of the Steel Soul-focused trophies, the omissions are mostly focused on minor challenges, or at least challenges that aren't as daunting as the ones that remain. For instance, PSN doesn't have the Speed Completion trophy, requiring players to beat Hollow Knight: Silksong in 30 hours, but it does have its extreme variant, Speedrunner, which asks for a 5-hour run.

Why Is Silksong Missing Achievements on PlayStation?

Team Cherry did not comment on these omissions in any capacity. The differences are not unprecedented, as the original Hollow Knight was also missing achievements on PlayStation, where it offered 35 trophies compared to 63 on other platforms. Once upon a time, Sony was imposing strict achievement restrictions on non-full-priced games, which were not even allowed to include Platinum trophies. The policy was so rigid that it applied even to high-profile developers such as Konami, as Hideo Kojima once recounted when explaining why MGS 5: Ground Zeroes had a smaller PSN trophy list than other versions.

All of this, however, was over a decade ago. These days, shorter PlayStation trophy lists are more likely explained by design philosophy than by policy. As with Hollow Knight , Silksong ’s PlayStation achievement list emphasizes major progression milestones, potentially making each trophy more meaningful. And as with Hollow Knight’ s permadeath mode, Silksong ’s corresponding achievements are excluded on PlayStation, though the mode itself remains available on both the PS4 and PS5.

item.title: Best Games That Let You Play As A Humble Shopkeeper
item.description:
Summary

  • Potionomics brews a unique blend of card-based crafting and haggling.
  • Shoppe Keep offers chaotic fun by managing a medieval store.
  • Merchant of the Skies combines trading and exploration in a laid-back experience.

There’s a curious sort of satisfaction that comes from managing a shop , where the only concerns are whether the shelves are properly stocked or wares are fairly priced. Shopkeeping games offer a slow but engaging gameplay loop, one where customers, profits, and occasional strange requests become highlights of the day.

Some games feature deep economics, others treat the store as part of a greater adventure, but all share that cozy appeal of making a living without any urgent quest to save the universe. From haggling with customers to crafting the best wares possible, here are some games that prove keeping the lights on and shelves stocked can be just as engaging as slaying dragons.

Potionomics

Potion Seller, Give Me Your Strongest Potions

Potionomics
Simulation
Indie Games
RPG
Strategy
Systems
Released
October 17, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
e
Powered by

In Potionomics , running a magic shop becomes a full-blown performance. Players brew potions with a card-based crafting system, then sell them using a deck-building haggling mechanic where every turn matters. Each sale is a balance between maximizing profit and keeping customers happy enough to return.

Its narrative layer adds even more depth, with relationships that unlock perks and special ingredients. The art direction bursts with personality, making each customer interaction a little stage play of wit and persuasion. The result is a shop sim that feels as much about personality as inventory, and that personality is hard to resist.

Shoppe Keep

Customers With A Knife-Shaped 100% Discount Coupon

Platforms

PlayStation 4, Xbox One, PC, macOS, Linux

Released

August 20, 2015

Developer

Arvydas Žemaitis

Genre

Management Sim

Being tasked with running a chaotic medieval storefront where customers will happily shoplift if players are not paying attention is no easy job, but that’s exactly what Shoppe Keep demands . Carefully managing shelves, prices, and stock while keeping an eye out for thieves, with the occasional need to physically chase them down, is all part of a day’s work.

The fun is in the controlled chaos. Between crafting, cleaning, and crowd control, no two days feel the same. As the store grows, so does the madness, and soon, armor sales have to be juggled with trash cleanup and even taking up arms to deter thieves personally. It’s messy, frantic, and somehow deeply satisfying to keep the whole operation running.

Merchant Of The Skies

Airships, Commodities, And A Long Horizon

Merchant of the Skies
Simulation
Systems
Released
April 17, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
e
Powered by

Trading the storefront for a flying merchant vessel, Merchant of the Skies has players travel between floating islands, buying goods where they’re cheap and selling them where they’re not. The game is as much about exploration as it is about economics, with the routes chosen and ports visited shaping profit margins.

The charm comes from its laid-back pacing. There’s no ticking clock, just the slow satisfaction of building a trade empire one shipment at a time. Along the way, players can buy their own islands, expand their fleet, and even engage in light resource gathering, making each voyage feel like a step toward something bigger.

No Umbrellas Allowed

The Art Of Overcharging, Politely

3 Images
3 Images
No Umbrellas Allowed
Adventure
Puzzle
Simulation
Systems
Released
September 3, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Mild Language
Developer(s)
Hoochoo Game Studios
Powered by

Buying items from desperate townspeople and selling them for a profit sounds morally gray, because it is. No Umbrellas Allowed takes place in a dystopian setting where propaganda finds its way into daily transactions. The mechanics blend shopkeeping with careful reading of customer moods and market fluctuations.

What makes this game special is how the player's pricing decisions subtly influence relationships and story events. Some sales feel like little victories, others like personal compromises. It turns shopkeeping into a strange puzzle where every item is a piece of the world’s culture and economy, and every price tag is a test of the player’s conscience.

Travellers Rest

Brewing Business And Community

3 Images
3 Images
Travellers Rest
RPG
Indie Games
Adventure
Strategy
Systems
Released
July 28, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
nr
Developer(s)
Isolated Games, Louqou
Powered by

Though the store counter is replaced with a bar counter, Travellers Rest still carries the same shopkeeping spirit. Players run a Medieval inn, cooking meals, brewing ales, and upgrading their tavern into a cozy gathering spot for passing adventurers. While profit is the primary goal of the experience, its charm lies in creating a welcoming atmosphere for NPCs who start to feel more like family than customers.

The progression combines crafting with interior design, encouraging players to experiment with recipes and furniture layouts. Expansions in brewing add complexity over time, making the inn feel like a living, evolving place. It is as much about building a community hub as it is about managing inventory, which makes every pint served feel oddly meaningful.

Moonlighter

Midnight Markets And Moonlight Dungeons

Moonlighter
Adventure
Action RPG
Systems
Released
May 29, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Fantasy Violence
Developer(s)
Digital Sun
Powered by

Shopkeeper-turned-adventurer Will runs a store by day and raids dungeons by night. This dual structure in Moonlighter makes every sales decision directly tied to the player's risk-taking in combat. Rare loot means higher prices, but also has tougher enemies guarding it.

Selling items isn’t passive; players must set prices, watch customer reactions, and adjust accordingly. This feedback loop between adventuring and shopkeeping creates a compelling push and pull. Each morning feels like a reward for surviving the dangers of the night, and every evening feels like an investment in tomorrow’s profits.

Recettear: An Item Shop’s Tale

Where Dungeon Loot Meets Ledger Books

6 Images
6 Images
Recettear: An Item Shop’s Tale
Action
RPG
Indie
Systems
Released
September 10, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
EasyGameStation
Powered by

Recettear: An Item Shop’s Tale flips the RPG formula on its head. Instead of playing the hero, this is a game about supplying them. As Recette, a young girl trying to pay off her father's debt, players manage an item shop while also venturing into dungeons to restock inventory. The back and forth between negotiation with customers and action-RPG looting creates a cycle that feels endlessly satisfying.

Haggling isn’t just a side mechanic; it’s core to success, with each customer type having unique behaviors and price tolerances. The dungeon crawling is light but offers enough tension to keep the shop’s shelves from running dry. It’s a perfect combination of management sim and classic adventure.

Holy Potatoes! A Weapon Shop?!

Where Capitalism Meets Adorable Weaponry

6 Images
6 Images
Holy Potatoes! A Weapon Shop?!
Indie
Management
Simulation
Systems
Released
July 13, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E For Everyone: Alcohol Reference, Crude Humor, Mild Language, Violent References
Developer(s)
Daylight Studios
Powered by

With a name like this, it’s clear that this game would turn crafting into a comedy routine. Players have to run a blacksmith shop in a world populated by sentient potatoes, taking on bizarrely named heroes as clients. While the visual style of Holy Potatoes! A Weapon Shop?! is all charm, the management layer runs deeper than it looks; players must train staff, refine blueprints, and match weapon traits to customers’ needs.

The flow of humor is constant, poking fun at RPG tropes with every transaction. Even so, there’s a rhythm to managing materials and deadlines that scratches the classic simulation itch. Watching a squad of silly spuds hammer out legendary weapons for equally absurd adventurers is the kind of reward that keeps players smiling even while they're juggling orders like hot potatoes.
